title: Asking who a caller wants to talk to
context: Ask the person on the phone which employee they are trying to reach.

content.bestLine: Who can I connect you with today?

neutral.text: Who are you trying to reach?
Can I connect you with someone?
What's the name of the person you're calling for?
Who would you like to speak with?
Can you tell me who you're trying to reach?

formal.text: May I inquire as to who you are trying to reach?
To whom would you like to speak?
Could you please provide the name of the person you wish to speak with?
Who is the intended recipient of your call?
I'd be happy to connect you with the appropriate person. May I ask who that is?
Could you please tell me the name of the person you are trying to contact?

patterns.meaning: Asking who the caller wants to talk to
Asking for the caller's identity or intended recipient

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Hello, who can I connect you with today?

lines.speaker: Caller
lines.text: I'd like to speak with John, please.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Who are you trying to reach?

lines.speaker: Caller
lines.text: I'm not sure. Can you tell me who handles customer service?

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: That would be our customer service department. Let me connect you with them.
